intro: Dischidia brachystele, commonly known as the short-stemmed fig vine, is a climbing epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its unique growth habit allows it to thrive in humid, shaded environments, often found on trees in tropical rainforests. Dischidia brachystele is also notable for its ability to store water in its stems, aiding in its survival in less-than-ideal conditions.
